definitions.definition: The manner in which two things may be associated .
examples: The relation between diet and health is complex.

definitions.definition: A member of one's extended family ; a relative .
examples: Yes, he's a relation of mine, but only a distant one.

definitions.definition: A relationship ; the manner in which and tone with which people or states, etc. interact .
examples: the foreign relations of the United States

definitions.definition: The act of relating a story.
examples: Your relation of the events is different from mine.

subdefinitions.definition: A set of ordered pairs ; a binary relation .
examples: Equality is a symmetric relation , while divisibility is not.

definitions.definition: A set of tuples, implemented as a table in a relational database .
examples: This relation uses the customer's social security number as a key.

definitions.definition: A statement of equality of two products of generators , used in the presentation of a group .
A subobject of a product of objects .

definitions.label_groups: often collocated: sexual relation , often in the plural

main_definition: The manner in which two things may be associated .
secondary_definitions: A member of one's extended family ; a relative .
( chiefly in the plural ) A relationship ; the manner in which and tone with which people or states, etc. interact .
The act of relating a story.
( set theory ) A set of ordered tuples .
( databases ) A set of tuples, implemented as a table in a relational database .
( mathematics ) A statement of equality of two products of generators , used in the presentation of a group .
( category theory ) A subobject of a product of objects .
( often collocated: sexual relation , often in the plural ) The act of intercourse .
